thread.section_title: Science News and Analysis - Wall Street Journal
thread.title: Trump Tariff Plan Challenges Trade System U.S. Helped Build

author: Emre Peker
title: Trump Tariff Plan Challenges Trade System U.S. Helped Build
text:
President Donald Trump’s planned tariffs on steel and aluminum threaten a world-trading regime already battered by mounting protectionism and its struggle to tame China’s state-driven capitalism.
Mr. Trump is expected to sign a proclamation this week outlining his plan to impose the tariffs, which have angered close U.S. allies. European Union officials have suggested they could impose up to $3.5 billion in retaliatory tariffs on U.S. products almost immediately.
... RELATED VIDEO Will Trump's Import Tariffs Cause Trade Wars? President Trump signed an executive order on Tuesday that imposed tariffs on washing machines and solar panels. WSJ's Gerald F. Seib examined whether these moves could ignite a trade war with South Korea and China. Photo: AP (Originally Published January 24, 2018) To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
